thread.title: Baby found slashed at army camp, mother detained - Nation | The Star Online
thread.title_full: Baby found slashed at army camp, mother detained - Nation | The Star Online

title: Baby found slashed at army camp, mother detained - Nation | The Star Online
text:
Saturday, 4 February 2017 | MYT 7:58 PM Baby found slashed at army camp, mother detained 
MACHANG: Police have detained a woman for allegedly killing her two month-old baby girl at an army quarters at Kem Desa Pahlawan in Kok Lanas, Kota Baru, on Saturday. 
Kelantan police chief Datuk Dr Ab Rahman Ismail said the 32-year-old wife of an army corporal, was believed to have slashed the baby's throat with a knife. 
"The incident occurred at 2.45 pm while her husband was not at home. A neighbour, who realised the incident, reported the matter to the police," he told reporters when met at a Sepak Takraw tournament at Sekolah Rendah Jenis Kebangsaan Cina (SRJKC) Tei Hwa here. 
He said the suspect, from Kampung Jal, Tumpat, was with the baby when she was arrested. - Bernama
